attributes.action: Bring Autism and ADHD into The Equality Act of 2010 to prevent discrimination
attributes.additional_details: To support individuals with Autism or ADHD, or both to give them equal opportunity to everybody else in getting a job. It isn't their condition that stops it, sadly we live in a world where society places these barriers which makes getting employment much harder
attributes.background: To have Autism and ADHD recognised as a disability under The Equality Act of 2010

rejection.details:
The legal definition of disability is contained in the Equality Act 2010, which defines a disability as a physical or mental impairment, which is long term and has an adverse effect on the person’s ability to carry out day-to-day activities.

ADHD would be considered as a disability under the Equality Act 2010 if the traits of the condition were severe enough to affect the employee’s day-to-day living activity.

If you would like changes to this, you could submit a new petition about it.
